intro: Calonemorchis aerochila, commonly known as the aerial liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, leafy plant that typically grows on moist, shaded surfaces such as rocks or tree trunks. The plant has a distinctive structure with a prostrate stem and closely arranged, oval-shaped leaves. It is characterized by its ability to grow in aerial environments, often without soil contact. Calonemorchis aerochila is widely distributed in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded habitats.
